medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with thyroid dysgenesis at the age of 40 days due to prolonged jaundice. Thyroid function tests showed abnormal TSH and T4 levels. Ultrasound at 7 years revealed hypoplastic thyroid tissue, and later tests confirmed no uptake on scintigraphy at the age of 12 years. Cognitive development is mildly delayed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypoplastic thyroid tissue diagnosed at 40 days; L-thyroxine supplementation started at birth. No significant past medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: The father had a papillary thyroid carcinoma and polycystic kidney disease. No other relevant family history reported.
